channel.title: How to make rsps cheat client by your own?
channel.description: how to make rsps cheat client by your own? can some 1 tell me? im beginner at this :P

item.title: How to make rsps cheat client by your own?
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

1: Download their client
2: un-jar, decompile client.class
3: look at login protocol
4: use a fully decompiled client of the same revision/type - they all have so many mirrors.
5: trace code logic, make sure login protocols match between the two clients
6: make sure UID is correct from signlink.java (decompile and check yours) if not, change yours to theirs.
7: check if it has any type of mac-address verification on the client. You will want to override this.
8: implements your own way of creating data packets - typically use reflection. also add your noclip to your decompiled client.
9: compile and run using your client, not theirs.

That is a basic guide to making your own cheat client. Modify what you have, and possibly add a external frame for packet sending (like i did)
Except mine runs off of their client, and only the renamed version lol.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make rsps cheat client by your own?

item.title: How to make rsps cheat client by your own?
item.dc:creator: @Nael Nael
item.description:
@Nael wrote:

Kristen1234:

how to make rsps cheat client by your own? can some 1 tell me? im beginner at this

Kristen, if you’re looking to do a cheat client out of a decompiled client, that that’s what I can help you with (a client that shows you java sources files / editable class files and everything, like when you download it for your own server). If not, then that has to do with decompiling, which gives you recompiling errors…
For the decompiled version that you already have, you can open client.java and insert commands… Each source has it’s own way of starting a new command.

Read full topic
